document.docAuthor: Li, Wenliang, Qi, Ling & Yang, Ding
document.masterDocTitle: First record of the genus Trypetisoma Malloch, 1924 (Diptera, Lauxaniidae) for China with nine species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of the genus Trypetisoma Malloch, 1924 (Diptera, Lauxaniidae) for China with nine species

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Face with 1 V-shape median brown spot. Antenna brownish yellow to blackish brown, 1 st flagellomere yellow basally. Mesonotum with 2 narrow median brown band. Male genitalia ( Figs. 15–20 ): syntergosternite slen- der, incomplete circular in anterior view, breakage connected by membrane.
Description. MALE. Body length 2.1–2.4 mm , wing length 2.6–2.8 mm . FEMALE. Body length 2.2–2.3 mm , wing length 2.4–2.5 mm .

Head ( Fig. 11 ) pale yellow. Face brownish yellow with 1 V-shape median brown spot and with 1 brown spot on ventral margin; parafacial with 1 elliptic brown spot on apical margin. Frons brownish yellow except anterior margin yellow, with grayish white pruinescence, wider than long and anterior margin narrower than the posterior, trapeziform, with a pair of narrow brown median bands, extending to ocellar triangle; ocellar triangle blackish gray, oc developed, longer than anterior or ; anterior or about half length of the posterior, and each with 1 blackish brown basal spot. Gena about 1/5 eye height. Occiput with gray pruinescence. Antenna brownish yellow to blackish brown, 1 st flagellomere yellow basally and nearly 1.4 times longer than high; arista blackish brown except yellow basally, pubescent. 1 brown triangular spot present between antenna and eye. Proboscis pale yellow, with yellow and black hairs; palpus yellow except pale brown at apex, with black hairs.

Thorax ( Fig. 14 ) brown, with grayish yellow pruinescence. Mesonotum with 2 narrow median brown band indistinctly, extending from anterior margin to anterior of scutellum, postpronotum with posterior margin surrounded by 1 thin brown band, 3–4 brown spots between dc and supra-alar seta; 1+3 dc , 1st post-sutural dc near transverse scutal suture, presutural dc closer to anterior margin than presutural acr ; 1+3 acr , in 2 rows; prescutellar acr broken; dc , acr and prescutellar acr each with 1 brown basal spot. Anepisternum and katepisternum with gray pruinescence, anepisternum with 2 brown spots near dorsal margin, 1 brown spot near ventral margin, 2 anepst (the strongest one near posterior margin) and 3–4 short hairs; 2 kepst . Scutellum with grayish yellow pruinescence. Leg yellow, femora pale brown except pale yellow at apex, tibiae with 1 brown circle near base, apical tarsi brown. Fore femur with 5 pd , 3 pv ; fore tibia with 1 long dp , 2 short apv . Mid femur with 5 a, 1 app ; mid tibia with 1 strong dp , 1 apv . Hind femur with 2 apv on apical half, 1 preapical ad ; hind tibia with 1 dp , 1 short apv . Wing ( Fig. 12 ) anterior margin brown, posterior margin gray gradually; r-m and apical R 2+3 each with 1 hyaline transverse band, extending from anterior margin to the posterior; r 1 and r 3 cell each with 3 hyaline spots; with 1 hyaline apical spot between R 4+5 and M 1+2 ; posterior margin with circular or irregular hyaline spots; subcostal cell brown; costa with 2nd, 3rd and 4th sections in proportion of 9.7: 3.5: 2.2; r-m beind middle of discal cell; ultimate and penultimate sections of M
1 in
proportion of 6.9: 3.6; ultimate section of CuA 1 about 1/6 of penultimate section. Halter pale yellow except knob brown.

Material examined. ( HAUST ) 1 ♂, CHINA , Yunnan : Xishuangbanna, Mengla, Bubeng village, 2009. V. 9 , Tingting Zhang. 1 ♂,

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11–15.
Trypetisoma ( Trypaneoides ) fenestrata (de Meijere, 1910)
. Male. 11. head, anterior view; 12. wing; 13. habitus, lateral view; 14. thorax, dorsal view; 15. abdomen, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. China ( Yunnan , Tibet ), Indonesia , Japan , Malaysia . Remarks. The new species is very similar to
Trypetisoma ( Trypaneoides ) semicircularis
sp. nov.
from the Oriental region, but the latter wing r 3 cell with 4 hyaline spots, 2m 2 cell with more than 10 hyaline spots, tergites with bands; this species wing r 3 cell with 3 hyaline spots, 2m 2 cell with less than 10 hyaline spots, tergites without band.
